intro: Cacalia piptocarphodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, silvery-green leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, and they bloom in late summer to early fall. Cacalia piptocarphodes is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
